parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To raise, lift up, take away, remove.
Probably akin to phaino through the idea of disclosure; a tone; by implication, an address, saying or language.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
Master, teacher, chief, commander. From epi and a presumed derivative of histemi; an appointee over, i.e. Commander.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To pity, have mercy on. From eleos; to compassionate.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
